snippet: When Nissan asked Bose for a sound system for the Leaf that would not impede the E.V.’s range, Bose designed a system that draws half the current of a conventional Bose stereo.
abstract: Electric and hybrid cars are hundreds of pounds heavier than their gasoline-only counterparts, prompting automakers to ask their suppliers for parts that will not affect cars' range; stereo created by Bose for Nissan Leaf is smaller, lighter and draws half current of conventional Bose stereo, placing lighter burden on battery power.
lead_paragraph: When Nissan asked Bose for a sound system for the Leaf that would not impede the E.V.’s range, Bose designed a system that draws half the current of a conventional Bose stereo.

headline.main: Lightening the Load on an E.V.’s Batteries
headline.print_headline: Lightening the Load On an E.V.’s Batteries
